title: Bug 102436: Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: Bug 102436: Date/time value not stored correctly in report design. An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB: When creating a 'DateTime' type report parameter in the BIRT report designer, typing an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999', in the 'default value' field results in the invalid value being accepted. The report design shows the following definition: <parameters><scalarParameter name='dateParam1'><property name='dataType'>dateTime</property><property name='allowBlank'>false</property><property name='format'>Unformatted</property><property name='controlType'>textbox</property><expression name='defaultValue'>55/66/9999</expression></scalarParameter></parameters>. There are two issues here: (1) The model should have stored a dateTime type constant using the XML schema date/time format ('yyyymmddThh:mm:ss', as defined in http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema2/), which is locale independent and ensures portability.
SR:
To reproduce: 
1. Open the BIRT report designer. 
2. Create a 'DateTime' type report parameter. 
3. In the 'default value' field, enter an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999'.
